subject: Re: My EVP & ITC experimentation systems tour
author: M.A. Coletta (Mike)
full_text:
Hi Al,

To answer your first question I provide this link:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3S-4e-wxd6U
It's a video that better explains how I think it might work. (Just a 
couple of possibilites).

To answer your second question... I have done three experimentation 
sessions so far, and the results differ.  In one I got no response, 
and in the other two I did get action but I'm unsure on what caused 
it.  I'm reviewing it further.

My use of the Ion lamp, which is away from the traditional 'video-
loop' method is based on things I've read from those who were into 
this EVP/ITC thing way before us.  Back in the 1960's there was much 
experimentation going on that involved a varied range of frequencies, 
including light frequencies.  Even house plants were considered into 
the EVP/ITC equation (Maybe I'll try that next).

My use of the Ion lamp goes along with a continued desire to further 
the work of the dedicated group from the 1960's... and continue to 
see if 'other' ideas work.

After all... sweeping radio signals, and snowy video pictures are 
only a couple of snippets of the frequencies available for 
experimentation.  Even my limited idea of what the Ion lamp might do 
could be way off... but I have to try it.  I might be surprised what 
it might be capable of.  It might not only offer increased intensity 
and stimulation. Maybe it could even offer more than that.

I'll keep trying new things... and I'll make sure to share them with 
the group.

Thanks for asking...

- Mike



--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "threadsintyme@..." 
<Threadsintyme@...> wrote:
>
> An interesting setup, Mike...
> I do have a question though.,..what is the ion lamp for? 
> Have you had any success photographing any spirits?
> Al
> 
> -- "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" <michaelcoletta@...> wrote:

tour of

setup.

> 
> Thanks...
> and have a super-natural paranormal day!
> - Mike Coletta
